content: Here weself-assembled ananionic cage bycombiningGa3+cation, trishydrazide andsalicy laldehyde ina[6++4++12]manner .Thecage bears twelve sulfonic acidunits,endowingwater solubility .Thehydrazone bonds within thecage frame-work were observed toberemarkably robust inwater, helpingtoavoid hydrolysis that often occurs insome oftheself-assembled systems containing typical imine .Ontheonehand,thewater -compatibility allows thecage totake advantage ofhydrophobic effect torecognize guests inaqueous media. Ontheother hand, thenegative charges onthecage help toenhance thebinding affinity ofcage toaccommodate cationicguests ,some ofwhich areconsidered difficult toberecog-nized inwater duetotheir hydrophilicity .Different from mostofthepreviously reported coordination hosts ,[14]thecageprovides theguests with two binding modes ,ineitherinclusion orperipheral[15]manner ,orboth.Theconsequenceisthat, thecage isable torecognize awiderange ofguests ,whose sizes could beeither smaller than, orexceed thevolume oftheinner cavity ofthecage.Within theframeworkofasingle cage,allofthefour trishydrazone ligands ofthecage adopt thesame rotational conformation, andthesixGa3+vertexes have thesame axial chirality .Suchbehaviorsendow thecage homochirality ,andthecage product istherefore actually aracemic mixture oftwo homochiralenantiomers .Upon recognizing achiral guest, either inter-nally orexternally ,oneofthecage enantiomers became morethermodynamically favored than theother, producing CDsignals forchirality sensing .Theenantiomeric excess (ee)values ofavariety ofenantiomer mixtures could bedeter -mined quantitatively ,byrecording theCDsignal intensities .[*]G.Wu,Y.Chen, S.Fang,L.Tong,L.Shen, C.Ge,Prof. Y.Pan,Prof. H.LiDepartment ofChemist ry,Zhejiang Universi tyHangzhou 310027 (China)E-mail :lihao2015@zju .edu.cnX.ShiCollege ofGeograp hyandEnvironmen t,Shandong Normal Univer-sityJinan 250358 (P.R.China)Supportin ginforma tion andtheORCID identifica tion number(s) fortheauthor(s) ofthisarticle canbefound under :https ://doi.org/ 10.1002/ani e.2021041 64.
3?18Na£ºbenzene -1,3,5 -tricarboxylic acid trihydrazide (1 ) (0.427 g, 1.69 mmol) and 5 -sulpho- 2-hydroxybenzaldehyde ( 2) (1.03 g, 5.10 mmol) were stirred  in 50 mL  of MeOH .

GaCl 3 (0.447 g, 2.54 mmol) and NaOH (0.609 g, 15.2 mmol) were then added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 50 ¡ãC overnight . After cooling to room temperature, the residue was precipitated  by adding 75 mL of DCM . The resulting precipitation was  collected  by filtration and washed with ethyl acetate and hexanes, yielding 1.30 g of pale-yellow solid (76%) . 1H NMR ( 500 MHz, D 2O, 23 ¡ãC) ¦Ä 8.79 (s, 12H, H a), 8.51 (s, 12H, H b), 7.89 (d, J = 2. 3 hz, 12H, H c), 7.65 (dd, J = 8.9, 2.4 Hz, 12H , Hd), 6.73 (d, J = 9.0 Hz, 12H , He) ppm. 13C NMR (1 25 MHz, D2O, 23 ¡ãC) ¦Ä 169.0, 166.7, 157.9, 133.2, 132.0, 130.8, 130.7, 130.0, 121.4, 117.3 ppm . ESI-MS: m/z 549.5 [M+11Na+]7?, 644.9 [M+12Na+]6?, 778.7 [ M+13Na+]5?.
